blogPost.title: Snopes retracted 60 articles after a BuzzFeed News investigation found that David Mikkelson, its co-founder, plagiarized from news outlets in an attempt to scoop up web traffic. Mikkelson, who owns half the company, will continue as chief executive. https://t.co/Sl5yjvBpkU
blogPost.author: The New York Times

localize.full_text: Snopes社は、BuzzFeed Newsの調査により、同社の共同設立者であるデビッド・ミケルソンがウェブトラフィックを獲得するためにニュースリリースを盗用していたことが判明したため、60件の記事を撤回しました。会社の半分を所有しているミケルソンは、引き続き最高経営責任者を務めます。https://t.co/Sl5yjvBpkU
在BuzzFeed新闻网调查发现斯诺普公司的联合创始人大卫-米克尔森(David Mikkelson)抄袭新闻机构的文章，试图挖走网络流量后，斯诺普公司撤回了60篇文章。拥有该公司一半股份的米克尔森将继续担任首席执行官。https://t.co/Sl5yjvBpkU
在BuzzFeed新聞網調查發現斯諾普公司的聯合創始人大衛-米克爾森(David Mikkelson)抄襲新聞機構的文章，試圖挖走網絡流量後，斯諾普公司撤回了60篇文章。擁有該公司一半股份的米克爾森將繼續擔任首席執行官。https://t.co/Sl5yjvBpkU

previous.title: Breaking News: President Biden is accelerating the deployment of 1,000 additional American troops to Afghanistan to help U.S. citizens and Afghans who worked for the U.S. government evacuate from Kabul safely as the Taliban nears. https://t.co/vxzrKWPLoL

next.title: With the Taliban on the verge of regaining power in Afghanistan, some women are worried about what comes next. The group historically has barred women and girls from taking most jobs or receiving educations and essentially trapped them in their homes. https://t.co/GuSO3a5Cdo https://t.co/N8q5QZ8KUa
